186017030.review:
Kerbal Space Program (KSP) is a realistic space simulation. With the Kerbol system being a representism of the solar system. You can capture astroids and maybe even crash them into earth. Science mode depicts a space agency with infinite budget but with a lack of science. Science mode is more freindly for new players.
Carrer mode is the classic KSP experience. With budget, reputation, and science points.
Sandbox mode: the mode where you can do whatever you want. Has no budget, science, or reputation to worry about

10/10 Game. Would ABSOLUTELY recomend

What is there to say?
You are in charge of a bunch of silly green goons, doing extremely stupid things, except you are doing it the right way, the real way!
If you fancy to learn something about what the real physics of space flight is and what it takes to reach orbit or land on the moon, this is the only true, silly space simulator you can rely on.
Unfortunately Kerbal 2 will never come, so this is here to stay for a loooong time.

185727821.review:
I genuienly loathe that this buggy mess is still the best rocket building sim on the market.

Its fun if you like this kinda game. I do like it, hence the positive review, but man....the engine is notoriously fundamentally flawed, all I wanted for part two was having the same game on a proper engine. We do know how this went lol. Most but not all of the major bugs are fixed, some major bugs are unresolvable and have to be actively avoided, they became part of the gameplay. Lots of minor bugs still. The performance is atrocious, add any graphical mods and you'll need fat stacks to keep the 5% lows above 80.

BESIDES THE TERRIBLE ENGINE
Kerbals are charming, the solar system is interesting though somewhat lacking, overall content is somewhat lacking, controls and mechanics are fine considering the complexity and required information of it all. The difficulty is tough for the devs to hit the right spot with, personally I found it perfect, it allows for complex missions that have to be thought through but I dont have to sweat it too much.

The modding community is a godsent for this game, adds 80% to the value of the game.

All in all Id like to give it both 4/10 for the base game with all its bugs, but also 8/10 if you consider the modding and the fact that theres no proper alternative that allows for this scale and complexity.

185565087.review:
Plus qu'un jeu, Kerbal Space Program permet à la fois de s'amuser et d'apprendre beaucoup de choses sur l'aérospatial.
Comme dans Minecraft, il y a deux modes principaux : le mode créatif, qui permet de s’affranchir du côté financier et de débloquer toutes les pièces dès le départ, ou un mode carrière dans lequel il faudra faire des expériences pour obtenir des points de science nécessaires au déblocage des pièces de fusée ou d'avion. Dans ce mode, il faudra aussi remplir des contrats pour gagner de l'argent et ainsi financer votre programme spatial.
Je n'ai pas testé le mode créatif (et je ne suis pas sûr que ce soit le terme exact) car c'est un petit plaisir pour moi de débloquer des choses dans les jeux en les méritant. De plus, cela ajoute un côté gestion qui me parle. Par exemple, j'ai pris des contrats de tourisme spatial consistant à envoyer de riches touristes en orbite. Cela a nécessité la mise au point de nouveaux modèles de fusées permettant d'accueillir plusieurs touristes (il est possible de remplir plusieurs contrats en même temps en envoyant plusieurs touristes dans la même fusée). Il y a donc un côté "business" à jouer de cette façon qui peut ajouter un peu de piment.
KSP propose également tout un lore vraiment sympathique. Les personnages sont des Kerbals et ils ont vraiment un aspect et des expressions très mignonnes. La planète mère est Kerbin, elle possède deux lunes (la Mun et Minmus), et il y a tout un système solaire (ou plutôt système Kerbol pour être exact) à explorer.

Côté réalisme, le système Kerbol étant différent de notre système, il y a des particularités fictives. En revanche, techniquement, la mise en orbite, l'exploration spatiale et les lanceurs fonctionnent bien comme dans la réalité. C'est là que le ludique rencontre l'éducatif car en apprenant à faire des mises en orbite dans KSP, vous apprendrez comment cela fonctionne dans la réalité.

Attention : il existe un KSP 2, mais restez sur le premier opus ! En effet, le 2 n'a pas été fait par la même équipe, et il y a de fortes chances que celui-ci ne soit jamais fini (il est actuellement en accès anticipé). De plus, il y a une volonté de simplifier le jeu, ce qui est totalement absurde en ce qui concerne KSP.
Il est vrai que KSP 1 est un peu daté graphiquement, mais il existe de nombreux mods gratuits permettant de lui redonner une nouvelle jeunesse très facilement. De plus, vous trouverez de nombreuses vidéos sur YouTube expliquant très clairement comment améliorer KSP.

185521246.review:
Решил стать ракетостроителем, собрал корабль, нажал «Пуск»... и через 5 секунд мой модуль превратился в фейерверк где-то в атмосфере. В Kerbal Space Program ты учишься на своих ошибках – точнее, на ошибках своих ракет. 
То недотянул до орбиты, то перекрутил ускорители, то отправил бедного Кербала в космос без парашюта. Но зато, когда всё-таки выйдешь на стабильную орбиту, чувствуешь себя настоящим гением. Это игра, где наука встречается с хаосом, а успех – это всего лишь ракета, которая не взорвалась при старте.

185391904.review:
Kerbal Space Program isn’t just a game; it’s an experience. It’s about pushing boundaries, embracing failure, and celebrating those moments where everything (miraculously) goes right. It’s also about having a laugh at the ridiculousness of it all.

If you’ve got the patience to learn and the sense of humor to laugh at your mistakes, you’ll absolutely love this game. Just remember: always double-check your staging and never underestimate the power of a well-placed strut.

185354902.review:
C'est un très bon jeu pour apprendre les règles de sécurité et de prévention. Ce jeu est vraiment cool, mais un peu complexe à comprendre pour quelqu'un qui n'y connaît pas grand-chose. Cependant, la prise en main est assez facile et rapide. De plus, il propose des moyens très intuitifs pour nous accompagner dans votre conquête spatiale.

Le jeu de base est très agréable, mais on en fait rapidement le tour. Pour éviter de tourner en rond, je recommande tout de même l'installation de mods pour une meilleure expérience de jeu, avec un gameplay plus varié et offrant davantage de possibilités.

185326282.review: S-tier edutainment. When I get I handle on the simplified physics of the base game (will probably take dozens of hours), I look forward to trying out mods that expand on it (eg Principia) and that account for radiation, oxygen, etc (Kerbalism). Deep and really scratches a creativity and curiosity itch.

185296527.review: A true magical experience. This game amplified my interest and passion for space and aeronautics, allowing me to explore both through fun trial and error at a young age (my dad bought this game for me about 10 or 11 years ago when I was still a teenager). I've used this game to teach my wife about space, aerodynamics, and science in general, and now that we have a daughter, she will certainly be learning in the same way.

184906630.review:
I do not think I could say just how much this game means to me, and certainly many others. Kerbal Space Program is one of the best and friendliest, if not the best online communities. I could try and describe it, but I would not be doing it justice. It is, however, akin to more of a learning process than a gameplay loop for a while after your first session, which I never had, and still do not have a problem with, you will never run out of things to learn, especially with community mods. 

I do not think I could recommend this enough, no number could say just how much the developers worked on this game, and how much the community cares about it. I have many more hours, throughout external software on this game then Steam says, well over 1500+ over 2 years. Many, thousands of mods have been created to suit everyone's play style. Please, do yourself a favor, get the game, there are many sales with always a 50-75% discount.

Oh yeah, also, do not by the Triple-A abandon-ware, cesspool that is Kerbal Space Program 2, there isn't even a studio for the game any more.

184847520.review: I LOVE THE NEW COKPIT,S IN KSP

184830055.review:
Kerbal space program is an incredible game. The physics engine is very accurate to real life and all parts have an existing counterpart. The best example for this is that you will most likely found yourself reading wikipidea article about rocketry or NASA papers.
KSP is also a sandbox, you aren't forced to do anything. You can build a moon base, an interstellar probe or an ICBM. You can even play Kerbal air program and have fun building planes (note that the physics engine isn't made for this, you might want to download a mod like FAR). 
Speaking of mods, KSP is, to my opinion, better enjoyed modded. Weather that would be just EVE to upgrade the graphics, Kcalbeloh to add new stars systems or a mod to add new parts, the only your imagination.
The learning curve is easier than you would think, you basically just need to learn to get to orbit and create maneuvers to fly a rocket. Its not rocket science, really. As you progress into the game, you will learn to be more efficient and tackle some of the most difficult missions like Jool five or Eve returns.
Overall, KSP is a really great game that I would highly recommend. Easy 9/10

184828192.review: Самая полезная игра для пап, которые хотят устроить полезный досуг с детьми и показать проявление основных законов ньютоновской механики в движении космических тел. И принципы ракетостроения, разумеется.

184821861.review:
[h1]Hard to decide[/h1]
Re-posted as I made a mistake affiliating this with the devs of KSP 2. Firstly I apologise for that. Secondly. NEVER get KSP 2

Many hours of enjoyment have been had with this game, However I never really decided if I liked it or not. I happily Admit I was never very good at it. That fact never stopped me playing though. However would I recommend it? Yes but with a slice of no. I really would never say buy this at full price, understand the "game" is physics based and if you don't enjoy a true science challenge you can either ignore the game or use mods to completely bypass the "sim" side of it. And because of that I would just say get another game.

For me, it is a yes get it, but you have been warned.

184797743.review: You wanna be a rocket man? Become a rocket scientist. You wanna become a space man? Play a space game and get more disappointed with society. You wanna become intimately aware of gravity, how to travel through it's troughs and valleys, and how to make it your bitch? Play Kerbal Space Program.

184797284.review:
Take a look at how many hours I've played and ask me again if I recommend Kerbal Space Program. The most amazing thing about this playtime is it doesn't even come close the the play-times of the top players of the game.

It's hard to put into words the satisfaction you get while playing this game. From your first orbit of the planet Kerbin, to landing on the Mun (and returning), to visiting the vastly different planets in the Kerbol System. Its trying, failing, improving, and succeeding. It can be tough but God its so good.

While the failure of KSP2 is sad, KSP1 with mods has already surpassed it.

Get this game, and get to work.

Es el juego perfecto de exploración espacial, y construcción de naves y cohetes.
Es muy divertido si te gustan temas como la exploración espacial.

Que decir, se podría decir que es mi juego favorito, pero no lo es, por el simple hecho de que soy una persona un poco floja, lo que provoca que no le meta muchas horas más a este juego. 
Personalmente, te recomiendo este juego y no te preocupes si las cosas no salen bien, hay que aprender de los errores pasados para poder mejorar nuestro futuro. 184398822.review:
I put off KSP for years, thinking it to be just some silly waste of time game (blame the Kerbals). Man, was I wrong. The game is nearly 10-years old (longer if you include early access), and I honestly think this is some of the best PC game money I've ever spent. I started with the base game and was immediately hooked. Back to Steam I went to buy all the DLC as well. I paid $70 for it all. Two weeks later it went on sale for a little over $20 for the whole package. The game is so good I wasn't even mad about it. Zero regrets, because it's worth every penny I spent and much more.

If you have any interest in how rockets achieve orbit, travel to the mun, deploy satellites and space stations, then this game is most definitely for you.

183989328.review:
Strauss Zelnick, as CEO of Take-Two Interactive, holds significant power and responsibility over the projects his company undertakes.

When Take-Two Interactive acquired the Kerbal Space Program franchise, fans had high hopes that the sequel would uphold the legacy of the original. Instead, KSP 2 launched in early access with significant performance issues, missing promised features, and a lack of transparency about its development timeline.

As CEO, Strauss Zelnick sets the tone for Take-Two’s corporate practices. His leadership directly influences the strategic and ethical direction of the company.

One of the most controversial aspects of KSP 2’s troubled development was the abrupt closure of Star Theory Games, the original studio behind the sequel. In 2020, Take-Two Interactive reportedly poached Star Theory employees to form Intercept Games, effectively dismantling the studio. This aggressive maneuver led to mass layoffs, leaving many talented developers without jobs and raising serious questions about Take-Two’s ethical practices. Such actions not only disrupted lives but also undermined the continuity and quality of KSP 2’s development. The fallout from these decisions highlights a broader pattern of corporate indifference under Strauss Zelnick’s leadership, where the pursuit of control and profits came at the expense of human capital and the integrity of the project. This disregard for the welfare of employees further strengthens the case for holding Zelnick accountable in court.

By holding Strauss Zelnick accountable in court, we send a strong message to the industry: corporate greed and consumer exploitation will not be tolerated.

183874160.review: If you enjoy Space games, this one is like the ultimate spaceship building game. Fun and extremely challenging in terms of the intelligence needed to carry out what you want (It took me 10+ hours to learn to orbit Kerbin). But once you get the ball  rolling, you'll find yourself setting up satellites on the Mun and Minmus, landing on Duna and exploring the jool system. Props to you if you can do a manned mission to Eeloo though, that is something I have not been able to do and bring my Kerbals home again. 9/10

183868810.review: Intercept Games? Private Division being sold? Kerbal Space Program 2? What are you talking about, there is no sequel! Now hop on KSP, download MechJeb and build some janky rockets, it'll be fun!

183684524.review:
Steps of playing this game:
1. See it at youtube or idk
2. Buy this game
3. Instal and play it for the first time
4. Decide to do a Science mode
5. Grind the Science
6. After 5 months ( depends if u grind hard ) u unlock all of the tech tree
7. Decide to play Sandbox
8. Being Matt Lowne
9. Make a space station 
10. Buying all of the DLC
11. Making some insane builds like a Laythe colony
12. Instaling Mods
13. Making a break from the game

10000/10 flipping love it
